abstract: New York Department of Consumer Affairs says Whole Foods Market is overstating weight of some prepackaged products sold in stores in city.
lead_paragraph: The New York Department of Consumer Affairs said the grocery chain sold prepackaged products labeled with incorrect weights in its nine city locations.

headline.main: Whole Foods Accused of Overcharging in New York City Stores
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Whole Foods Market Accused of Overcharging in New York

snippet: The New York Department of Consumer Affairs said the grocery chain sold prepackaged products labeled with incorrect weights in its nine city locations.
